title: What is a contactless transaction? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is the most Requested Question I have received: In easy means: Contactless Transaction is nothing but tapping your debit or credit card to the new machine , it then access your card and make the require payments. In broader terms : Contactless payment is a secure method for consumers to purchase products or services using a debit, credit, or smartcard—also known as a chip card—by using RFID technology or near-field communication (NFC). How to use : To make a contactless payment, tap your card near a point-of-sale terminal that is equipped with the contactless payment technology. Since contactless payments do not require a signature or a personal identification number (PIN), transaction sizes on cards are limited. The allowable amount for a contactless transaction varies by country and by the bank. I hope this information was helpful :) Follow and upvote the answer , it would be helpful for me :)

It is otherwise called RFID. By wifi the card details are entered while shopping where this facility is available and the amount is entered by the shop billing man. You need not enter the pin number. The upper limit for the RFID transaction is 2000 INR only. The facility is mainly meant for elderly senior citizen who are unable to enter the pin
